Detailed Description

Data structures for the scheduler managing threads with a priority and a period.

Member Function Documentation

virtual FixedPriorityThread* FixedPriorityScheduler::FindNextToRun (   )  [virtual]
 

Dequeue first thread of the ready list, if any, and return thread.

Return the next thread to be scheduled onto the CPU. If there are no ready threads, return NULL. Side effect: Thread is removed from the ready list.

Returns:
Thread to be scheduled on the CPU

Reimplemented from Scheduler.

bool FixedPriorityScheduler::IsAllProcReady (   )  [inline]
 

virtual void FixedPriorityScheduler::ReadyToRun (  Thread *  thread  )  [virtual]
 

Inserts a thread in the ready list.

Mark a thread as ready, but not running. Put it on the ready list, for later scheduling onto the CPU.

Parameters:
thread is the thread to be put on the ready list.

Reimplemented from Scheduler.
